title: Episode 25 - "Freak Show"
guest_stars: Wylie Gustafson, Bill Manspeaker (of Green Jellÿ)

transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed
WAITING

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Wylie on monitor) It's the oldest thing in the universe, man. I'm working in a vacuum for the better part of three years, who tells me anything except the audience... (Wylie disappears from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: (appears on monitor) Mr. Ghost, Mr. ...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, what happened to Wylie?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Not my fault.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But I wasn't finished talking to him.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (on the monitor) It's not my fault!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Did I say it was? Man, you don't have to get huffy with me!

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: (replaces Moltar on monitor) nuqneH, Space Ghost, prepare yourself for a dose of my spank ray! I'm your worst nightmare! Warp factor nine and prosper! I'll be back! (image disappears from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stares in shock) Whoa!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in to set) Greetings there, o people my people! Tonight, we've got a really fun show lined up for you that we think you be just tickled about! Wylie Gustafson of "Wylie and the Wild West Picture Show" is here, and he's going to yodel for us! (short pause) Isn't that grand? (short pause) Please say "hey now" to Zorak and the Original Way Outs!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk) Please welcome Wylie Gustafson! (Wylie on monitor lowering from the ceiling) Hello, Wylie, welcome to the show!

transcript.speaker: Wylie Gustafson
transcript.dialogue: Alright, thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wylie's gonna yodel for us, right, Wylie?

transcript.speaker: Wylie Gustafson
transcript.dialogue: Yeah! I can do that. Uh ... (disappears from monitor, replaced by Commander Andy)

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Be-de-be-de-be-de-be-de-be-de, I'm back, buck! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aw, crimony in the bucket! Moltar, are you behind all of this?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I didn't do it, it's some kind of pirate channel!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, can't you trace it?

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Tracing will do you no good, Space Ghost. I am on an undetraceable sub-space frequency that is carried on a carrier beam that is disguised as a normal holiday Romulan holiday greeting.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh-kay. Sparky, I don't know what you did to the yodeler, but when I find out where you are, I ...

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Silence! I want to talk to Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (looks back)

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Hi, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What!?

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Gimme some gum! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Geek!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, geek. Release your satellite transmission this instant!

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Oh, but that would go against my prime directive, Space Ghost. You see, my ultimate plan is to ... (he is interrupted by his mother, off camera) (shouting) What? ... No, I'm not, I'm not doin' anything... no, I did... I did that already... I said, I already did the dishes...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, Moltar, he's distracted.

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: (in background) I did... No! You didn't say you wanted them dried...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Let's see what this scrambler blast does. (throws lever) (Wylie returns to the monitor, playing his guitar and yodeling)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (after song finishes) Ahhhh, now that was soothing! Er, sorry about the interruption, Wylie, some nuthead from... Er, where was he from, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ah, the trace only got as far as Rigel IV.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, wherever he was from, he interrupted our feed! And that's why, er, we, you know, he, um... (short cough) Hey, Wylie, how about doing a yodel for me?

transcript.speaker: Wylie Gustafson
transcript.dialogue: (singing and playing guitar)He did the Space Ghost yodel, (yodels)The Space Ghost yodel, (yodels)The Space Ghost yodel, (yodels)(longer yodeling, big finish)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now Wylie, have you ever been to the Grand Old... (clears throat) excuse me... Have you ever been to the... (coughs loudly) Zorak, be a dear and get me some water.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Is that my only part in this show? A water bug? (Space Ghost coughs loudly in background) Look, I'm a mantis, not a silverfish!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stops coughing) Huh?

transcript.speaker: Wylie Gustafson
transcript.dialogue: Uh...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You know, silverfish. A tiny active fresh water crustacean, found mainly in the southwestern United States.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I think you're describing a water flea.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yup, I think that's a water flea. How 'bout it, Wylie? Water flea or no?

transcript.speaker: Wylie Gustafson
transcript.dialogue: I'll, I think so, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, it all winds up meaning that I have a crappy part in this week's show!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mantises, eh, Wylie?
INTERRUPT FEED

transcript.speaker: Wylie Gustafson
transcript.dialogue: When I was in college, I was in a, a rock band, but then after playing rock for a while, I went back to country, because, you know, you can't yodel in rock and roll. (starts playing his guitar)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I know, tell me about it! (to audience) We're back with Wylie Gustafson of "Wylie and the Wild West Picture Show". He's a yodeleer. Now tell me, Citizen, how big of an influence was "Hee Haw" on your career?

transcript.speaker: Wylie Gustafson
transcript.dialogue: A huge influence. Uh, "Hee Haw" was probably my most watched show, when I was a kid.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey Zorak, do you remember Junior Samples, that lovable fat used car dealer?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (banjo music in background) (with hillbilly accent) Jes' call B R five four nine! (holding sign which says "BR-549")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, do you remember him? (Wylie disappears from monitor, replaced by Commander Andy again)

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: (Minnie Pearl style) How-dy! "Lombaak ecree oplom ah-plee ozona ah-ah."

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stares in shock)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sarcastically) Can I help you?

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: That's what Zorak said when he controlled your brain, in Episode 6, the "Banjo" episode. 'Member?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What a maroon!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, you're only amusing yourself, son.

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: "Why do we always hurt the ones we love? Banjo! Banjo! Banjo!"

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: By the way, mister, for your information, the "Banjo" episode was Episode number 7, not 6. You're busted!

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that's right! I'm so stupid! I'm so stupid, stupid, stupid, stupid, stupid, stupid, stupid, stupid, stupid, stupid, stupid...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, you just think about that, son, maybe you'll be a little more careful next time. (makes "power band" moves) Now release the dang feed!

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Ah! (makes his own power band moves) testy, testy! Got a few demands that need to be met before I relinquish my control.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, what is going on with the feed?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's not my fault!

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Alright, here are my demands, Space Man, Space Master. Get it? The Professor! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. Moltar!!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I'm working on it!

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Moltar cannot help you anymore, Space Guy. 'Cause my power's much too strong for that molten man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who are you?

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: I am Commander... wait, hold on... (goes off camera)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Stinkin' pirates! (throwing lever, trying to break the feed)

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: (returns with paper towel tube with one sheet still attached) I'm back. (tears off the last sheet and talks through the tube) I'm Commander Andy of the Cosmos! I've come to take over your show! (talks normally) I'm a big fan!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I believe you had some demands?

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah, I want some free stuff. I want free coffee mugs like you have in the commissary. I want free T-shirts, the kind that don't shrink. And I want a free replica of the Phantom Cruiser, not the crappy 80's version. (Herndon's face appears on screen as he talks)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (smugly) Uh huh. Is that all?

transcript.speaker: Herndon
transcript.dialogue: Want an autograph.

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yes, and my cousin Herndon wants an autograph.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, aren't you sweet! I'm sure I'd be happy to...

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: (Herndon whispers to him) No, he wants Zorak and Moltar's autograph. And some gum. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Dorkly.

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Hey! I want to know what the deal was with Episode number 11. The one with the storyteller guy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about.

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: You know the one! Uh, I had a party over here, at my place, to watch a whole new episode of Space Ghost, like they advertise, but really it was this crappy rehashing of two old episodes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm afraid you'll have to direct those questions to our friends in programming. They can be reached at area code...

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: 'Cause you really disappointed me when... (his phone rings, he answers it) Hello? ... Oh, it's you, Scully... Is Mulder investigating the disturbance in Roswell, New Mexico? ... Yeah? ...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Pssst! Quick, Moltar! Now's our chance!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ah, I wonder what this lever does? (throws it, all power dies, screen goes blank, test tone is heard) Whoops!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (inviso sound) Did you get it?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Don't sneak up on me like that!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Did it work?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh... I don't know. (turns power back on, Space Ghost and Moltar are in control room)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, at least you got him to shut up. (invisos back to desk) So, is the yodeler totally gone? Sayonara?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: He's gone. And it's not my fault!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Eh, anyone else for me to talk to?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, uh, maybe... let's see here (throws lever, weird character appears, with makeup, costume and fake hands)

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: Hello, Mr. Space Ghost, where are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And just who are you supposed to be?

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: I'm 100% stupid.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Moltar, do you have any non-freaks to put in my monitor?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well... uh... no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, well that's just great!

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: Where's Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, shut up!

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: I want Space Ghost now, where is he?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back)

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: Are you like Jeannie or Bewitched?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back)

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: First we start it off with a little guitar (plays air guitar chord) And then I go, "Yeaaaaaah!" And then the girls go, "Woooooo!" And then I go, "Hot mamas!" And then they go, "And here's a whole bunch o' money!" And then I take all the money and then I go out and I try to buy Apple Jacks, but do you know what, the secret service is coming, and they start hittin' me, and they're hittin', stop hittin' me, who's talkin' to me, stop it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back)

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: You look like a woman on the TV.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, that's it. I can't take this anymore.

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, no, don't leave me!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (zaps the monitor with his destructo ray) Anybody have any idea who that was?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Some lost soul, cowering behind a cheap costume, afraid to reveal his true identity.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (glares at Zorak) (Commander Andy reappears on monitor) Aw, for the love of Don Bohannon! What now?

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: I am not amused. If I was in the same room with you right now I would give you the Vulcan nerve pinch and knock you out.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh-kay. I've had all I need out of you, mister house-breaking wee-wee pants. (zaps the monitor with his destructo ray, but ray bounces back) Aaa!

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) You see, I've installed this in-, this new ultra-galactic spheroidal backlash wompoma. It, it prevents you from harming me or any of my equipment through reverse transmission. Oh, and I have one more demand.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What do you want?!

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Actually, it's two more demands. I want a jump rope, with, with the wooden handles so, like, it's easy to turn. I want Super Elastic Bubble Plastic.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: More lines for Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Lines for Zorak, yes, some more of those. A lockable diary.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aaargh! Anything else?

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Yes. I want a little brother. (pause) And that's it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (deep sigh)

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Oh yes, and one more thing. I want at least one episode of Space Ghost to have a decent ending, not one that just is abruptly interrupted by the theme

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Cop out, cop out, cop out!

transcript.speaker: Commander Andy
transcript.dialogue: Ohhh, oh, oh, whoa, just one more thing. One! (laughs)
